column4: Hello guys, what's the best way of sharing files between 2 Ubuntu machines in a LAN?
Because I heard samba is best for sharing between Windows and Linux boxes
so if I have two Ubuntu boxes do I have a better choice?
thanks, would you mind explain a little more? of course I could just google around if otherwise
I've not heard anything about scp
SSH is used for secure access to resources.  scp is a tool to copy files over SSH.
ok, so I need to setup a SSH server on one of my Linux boxes right
You will need SSH server instances on both computers if you wish to access either of them from any one.
ok thanks, I'll google for a howto on SSH
You can then access both computers using Nautilus or the command line.
Try this first:  Places > Connect to Server... > Service Type: SSH
It will create a network mount on your Desktop.  Just click and you'll be able to copy files pretty easily.
I'm trying, waiting for apt-get to finish
and it's just what I want
